availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p: A list of the votes taken at Brinkleys Store on the 3'rd Day of Feb. 1862 for member to the Legislature

Voters Names
L Brinkley
James M. Smith Clerk
A list of votes taken at Brinkleys Store February 3rd 1862

L Brinkley
Voters Names
U. L. Wilson 1
J. C. Crawford 2
William Dick 3
William. H. Watson 4
L. E. Wilson 5
A. G. Grugett 6
James. M. Smith 7
Brot over from first Page 25
32
James. M. Smith Clerk
This is a true statement of the vote taken at Brinkleys Store District No 4 Calloway County Ky for member to the Legislature L Brinkley 32 given under our hands this 3rd Febr. 1862

W. H. Watson
L. E. Wilson} Judes

State of Kentucky
Graves County

On this day W H Watson, L E Wilson & James M Smith all resident citizens loyal & legal voters of district No 4 in Calloway County state of Kentucky appeared before the undersigned & made oath that the officers whose ^s^ duty it was to apoint officers to conduct the Election for Representative from Calloway Co Ky in place of David Marthenson expelled on the 3rd day of Feby 1862 failed to appoint such officers to hold the Election in district No four in Calloway County Ky and that the polls in said district No 4 in said County of Calloway were not opened by 9 oclock A M on the 3rd day of Feby 1862 and that being citizens legal & loyal voters of said district No 4 they did open the polls in said district No 4 after the hour of 9 oclock AM on said 3rd day of Feby 1862 & conducted the Election according to law ^and that the county officers to whom election returns should be made are in rebellion against the state of Ky and national government^ & the result was as is herewith reported

Wm H Watson
L. G. Wilson
James. M. Smith
Subscribed & sworn to before me by W H Watson Feby 4h 1862
J N Beadles Notary public
Subscribed and Sworn to before me by L W Wilson Feby 5h 1862
J N Beadles Notary Public
Subscribed and Sworn to before me by James M. Smith Feby 6th 1862
J N Beadles Notary Public
Calloway County State of Kentucky

The undersigned W H Watson L E Wilson & James M Smith being sworn as the law directs do hereby certify that we are resident citizens of district No 4 in Calloway Co Ky. legal & loyal voters of said district & that we did on the 3rd day of Feby 1862 after the hour of 9 oclock A M open the polls in said district No 4 in said County & take the vote of the legal voters of said district presenting themselves for a member of the Legislature from Calloway County ^Kentucky^ in place of Daniel Marthenson expelled & at the close of the polls the vote stood as follows for L Brinkley Thirty two votes we further certify that the Clerk of the Calloway County Court is in Rebellion against the National Government we further certify that the vote we took in said district we at the regular voting place in said district

W H Watson
L. E. Wilson } Judges
James M. Smith Clerk
